channel.title: Beastmode your school PC!@!@!
channel.description:
[center][u][b]This guide will explain in detail how to do the following:[/b][/u]
[ul][li]Gain access to Administrator account[/li] [li]Set up remote access[/li] [li]Install/Uninstall programs[/li][/ul]
Requirements:
[ul][li]LogMeIn Account(For remote control)[/li] [li]CD Burner(For ohpcrack live cd) [/li][li]15-30 minutes of time at computer without being seen(For cracking)[/li][/ul]
[b][u][size=15pt]First things first, gaining access to the Administrators account.[/size][/b]
This is a lot easier than you might think, using my favorite SAM cracker, Ophcrack. It's available for installation on a live cd [url=http://downloads.sourceforge.net/ophcrack/ophcrack-xp-livecd-2.3.1.iso]here[/url].
Simply download the ISO, and burn it to a disk using any ISO burning software(I use MagicISO, very handy).
You'll have to choose the "Boot from CD Drive" option in your computers BIOS. Chances are your school computers are configured to boot from CD first anyways due to the way they're set up(usually by network, but sometimes by CD/USB as in my schools case). So in most cases, just pop in the CD and boot up.
You should come to the start up screen: [img]http://img3.imageshack.us/img3/4751/welcomescreenu.png[/img]
School computers are usually set up with enough RAM, so I suggest running the Automatic mode, which has a nice OS looking GUI.
Once it's loaded, you should see this screen: [img]http://img21.imageshack.us/img21/7582/dbimager.jpg[/img]
It should start automatically; if it doesn't, hit the load button and it will load the tables onto the computers RAM, and start cracking. The password you'll use to login to the account is the one in the "[b]NT Pwd[/b]" column. Make sure to write down all the passwords, just incase you forget or want another account for future use.
[b][u][size=15pt]Setting up remote access[/size][/b]
[img]http://img17.imageshack.us/img17/1778/logmeinhome.png[/img] For remote access, we're going to be using [url=https://secure.logmein.com/]LogMeIn[/url]. LogMeIn is a program similar to Teamview. The only difference is that Teamview requires a user at the remote computer, and LogMeIn requires only a one time installation(and the password you cracked + one you set).
So go ahead and set up a LogMeIn account [url=https://secure.logmein.com/products/pro2/register.aspx]here[/url].
Once you've registered, I suggest you go to [b]Account[/b] settings, [b]Subscriptions[/b], and cancel any free trials that there might be(you wont be charged, I'm just explaining how to use the free version, so it might be easier to understand).
Now, go ahead and navigate to [b]Access[/b] > [b]My Computers[/b]. You should see an [b]Add Computer[/b] link near the right side of the page, click that.
Check the radio button for [b]LogMeIn Free[/b]. You can select Pro trial if you'd like, it's not a whole lot different, Free has all the basic features you'll need.
For the next step, you'll have to be at the remote computer(school PC in this case), and logged into the aforementioned Administrator account(or one with installation privileges).
[img]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/1830/isntalllogmein.png[/img] Follow the on screen instructions for adding the PC
[img]http://img49.imageshack.us/img49/7767/mycomputers.png[/img] Once fully installed, the computer should appear in the [b]My Computers[/b] section of the website.
From here on out, you have full remote access to the computer. As long as the computer is on(or you have LogMeIn Pro with [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wake-on-LAN]WOL[/url] enabled), you'll be able to access it from anywhere.
[b][u]Tips[/b] • Make installing LogMeIn the [u]first[/u] thing you do on the school computer. This will enable you to carry out your malicious activities from the safety of your own home, without the threat of a teacher watching you.
• Install LogMeIn on your home PC. This will enable you to retrieve files you might have forgotten at home, or let you access blocked websites from school. There is also a full screen mode, so you can tell your friends you've installed Vista(or whatever OS) on the school PC ^_^
[b][u][size=15pt]Installing/Uninstalling Programs[/size][/b]
You have full access to the computer through LogMeIn, so you can install or uninstall any program you'd like as you usually would on your home PC.
[u]Uninstallation Recommendations[/u]
[ul][li]Synchroneyes(or other monitoring software)[/li] [li]Networking Clients that may be used to see computer logs(Altiris Client, etc)[/li][/ul]
[u]Installation Recommendations[/u]
[ul][li]FireFox[/li] [li]LogMeIn(can you read? ._.)[/li] [li]Spotify(if your teacher allows the use of headphones[/li][/ul]
[size=8pt][u]Disclaimer[/u] If you get caught, chances are you will get in trouble. I'm not responsible, neither is Moparisthebest. You are performing these acts at your own will.
I read over my guide a good 10 times before I post it, but I always forget something. If you find yourself stuck, or see an error, tell me please :D[/size]
BloodRayne[a.k.a. Taylor][/center]

item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne

@bloodrayne wrote:

It still works for me :o I guess it’s possible they’re using different versions…

Read full topic

item.title: Beastmode your school PC!@!@!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:31, topic:306674”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=402844.msg3158725#msg3158725 date=1269294227]

If your school uses the Skyward grading system, I can write a guide on editing login packets, changing attendance for classes you’re enrolled in, and grades if you have your teachers ID.

But I don’t think your school uses it.
[/quote]My school uses Skyward

TamperData(or something similar) into Skyward, look for a value named usergroup or something(I forget) when logging in, and change it to 1 or 2, I forget… Play around. But be careful once you get it, you can change your school enrollment and classes… And if you do and can’t get it back, it’s going to look kind of awkward asking someone to fix it. I’m not responsible if you fuck up ;D good luck[/quote]That’s cool, but when I change myself to admin it says ‘No students available for viewing, aborting’

Read full topic

item.title: Beastmode your school PC!@!@!
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Follow up on the aforementioned; I got into a local server that student accounts were stored on along with some other stuff. Was able to delete/edit/corrupt that whole drive(I corrupted it on accident, meh). Also got into another server that stored a bunch of local files that student accounts read to at startup, was able to change the default background for every student, teacher, and staff member(it read to a certain background.jpg, create a new picture named background.jpg and delete the old one). My school also utilizes projectors on the ceiling instead of on carts, and whoopdeedoo each one has it’s own gui on the local server able to move projectors, turn on/off, upload images, zoom in on students with a camera on the projector and project it on the screen.

Not to mention a load of other stuff that my school doesn’t protect One of which is the LED sign out front, but I’m saving that for senior prank

[quote=“Davidi2, post:21, topic:306674”][quote author=BloodRayne link=topic=402844.msg2984552#msg2984552 date=1254874700]
If your school uses the Skyward grading system, I can write a guide on editing login packets, changing attendance for classes you’re enrolled in, and grades if you have your teachers ID.

But I don’t think your school uses it.
[/quote]My school uses Skyward :D[/quote]

TamperData(or something similar) into Skyward, look for a value named usergroup or something(I forget) when logging in, and change it to 1 or 2, I forget… Play around. But be careful once you get it, you can change your school enrollment and classes… And if you do and can’t get it back, it’s going to look kind of awkward asking someone to fix it. I’m not responsible if you fuck up ;D good luck

Read full topic

item.title: Beastmode your school PC!@!@!
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Which version of RM does your school run?

There are a few exploits which are available,

  1. When logging on, when it says “Loading user profile” or something similar, unplug the network cable and plug it back in when loaded for full administrator rights, you can do all sorts, like add all printers to your printers and scanners folder allowing you to print to every computer in the school!

  2. When using Adobe Dreamweaver use its explorer to navigate and you can browse the server and local file contents, you can also launch EXE files from here.

  3. You can launch EXE from ZIP files (older releases of RM)

  4. the user account propagate with password password has full admin network access (assuming your admin has not changed default password, once you login with this account I suggest changing the password so other school members do not have access!)

  5. RM Tutor Hack, Open a video with windows movie player, right click and select Show in RM Tutor 3

  6. Use VBS (found in excel) and launch programs from there

Set WshShell = WScript.CreateObject("WScript.Shell") Command = "%WINDIR%\Calc.exe" //example WshShell.Run Command

  1. EXE files may sometimes run from memory sticks too, try this for portable firefox.

view an old RM hack document here: http://www.textfiles.com/uploads/hackguide.txt

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Unhandled:

I know the computers at my school have a BIOS password that prevents changing the boot order anyways (obviously it is set to boot off the hard disk).

think up some creative ways to short across the cmos battery terminals for a few seconds

the most obvious of which is open the case, but thats not always possible rite

Read full topic

item.title: Beastmode your school PC!@!@!
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Unhandled:

OK, local admin has it’s uses (wireshark ;)), but there is no need to crack the password when it is far easier to create a local admin account through net user. I know the computers at my school have a BIOS password that prevents changing the boot order anyways (obviously it is set to boot off the hard disk).

I’ve been using Cain and Abel with winpcap, sorts out all the active logins and puts them in a list

Read full topic

item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

My schools have CD Drives disabled, either via BIOS or physically so I cannot use any Live CD’s to crack into them.
